title: Party of Democratic Activity
text:
The Party of Democratic Activity ( or A-SDA) was a <a href="conservative">conservative</a> <a href="list%20of%20political%20parties%20in%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">political party</a> in <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>.
History.
The party was established in February 2008 as a breakaway from the <a href="Party%20of%20Democratic%20Action">Party of Democratic Action</a>. Based in <a href="Cazin">Cazin</a>, its founders included town mayor Nermin Ogrešević. In the <a href="2010%20Bosnian%20general%20election">2010 general elections</a>, A-SDA ran only in the <a href="Federation%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a> part of Bosnia. It received 1.7% of the vote, failing to win a seat in the national <a href="House%20of%20Representatives%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">House of Representatives</a>, However, it won one seat in the <a href="House%20of%20Representatives%20of%20the%20Federation%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">House of Representatives of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a> with 1.9% of the vote.
In the <a href="2014%20Bosnian%20general%20election">2014 elections</a> the party increased its vote share to 2.25%, winning a seat in the national House of Representatives. It also won two seats in the Federal House. Its member of the country's legislature was <a href="Jasmin%20Emri%C4%87">Jasmin Emrić</a>, who holds a seat in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina's first division.
